summary: This is an internal incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center detailing an event on July 23, 2019, where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with red marks on his neck in his cell. He was placed on suicide watch after alleging his cellmate attempted to kill him, but during medical assessment he appeared ambulatory, smiling, and claimed not to know what happened. The report documents the medical and psychological assessments and notes plans to review his housing placement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found lying on the floor in a fetal position with red marks on his neck in the Special Housing Unit; he alleged his cellmate attempted to kill him and was placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: Responded to the call for assistance in the SHU, found Epstein, called out to him, noticed red marks on his neck, and initiated the response.

persons.name: Physician Assistant
persons.context: Medically assessed Epstein at 6:30 a.m., noting he was ambulatory, oriented, smiling, with erythema on his neck and knee, and that Epstein claimed not to know what happened.

persons.name: Psychologist
persons.context: Evaluated Epstein at 9:10 a.m. and determined he would remain on suicide watch for further observation.

connections.description: The Operations Lieutenant responded to the incident involving Epstein, found him, and initiated the emergency protocol.
The Physician Assistant conducted a medical assessment of Epstein following the incident, documenting his physical condition and statements.
The Psychologist evaluated Epstein's mental state and decided to keep him on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Found with Neck Injuries in Cell
events.description: Staff responded to a call in the Special Housing Unit and found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying on the floor in a fetal position with red marks on his neck. He was placed in hand restraints, escorted to a suicide cell, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Medical Assessment of Epstein
events.description: At 6:30 a.m., a Physician Assistant assessed Epstein, finding him ambulatory, oriented, and smiling, with a circular line of erythema on his neck and a small erythema on his left knee. Epstein claimed not to know what happened and did not want to discuss the events.

events.title: Psychological Evaluation and Suicide Watch Decision
events.description: At 9:10 a.m., a Psychologist evaluated Epstein and determined he would remain on suicide watch for further observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, Special Housing Unit (SHU)
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell lying on the floor in a fetal position with red marks on his neck, leading to him being placed on suicide watch.
Epstein alleged to staff that his cellmate had attempted to kill him and had been harassing him, and that he had informed his attorney about this matter.
During a medical assessment, Epstein was observed to be ambulatory, oriented, and smiling, but claimed not to know what happened and could not explain the marks on his neck.

The medical examination documented a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck, approximately 2 inches wide and covering two-thirds of the neck circumference, with friction marks in the front.
The facility was reviewing Epstein's case for placement in the general population in Unit 7 South and was looking for an appropriate cellmate at the time of the report.
